conbody.p: The different labels and form fields can be added by dragging and dropping widgets from the Palette menu. The properties sheet is used, for example, to translate a label or to increase the size of a text area. Since, in general, a single label and form field is added to each horizontal box, the different labels are automatically aligned vertically with each other while the form fields are displayed one below the other.
Below are examples of more complex positioning with the Street and Email sections.

In the Street section, we add a vertical box instead of simply adding a text field after the label. Within this box, we can position three text fields. Also, the vertical alignment of the label "Street" is set to the top.
The Email section consists of two horizontal boxes. A glue widget is added after the last box to "glue" the widgets to the left-hand side of the module.
